Line 23: Line 23:
Ubuntulite is an independent project to create a [[Linux distribution|distribution]] based on [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]] capable to run on so limited [[hardware]] as an [[Intel]] 486DX at 66 MHz with 32 MB of [[Random access memory|RAM memory]]. Opposed to other variants of [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]], Ubuntulite is focused on [[software]] packages with low resource consumption. Currently ships with the [[LXDE]] desktop environment that use like default window manager [[Openbox]].
Ubuntulite is an independent project to create a [[Linux distribution|distribution]] based on [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]] capable to run on so limited [[hardware]] as an [[Intel]] 486DX at 66 MHz with 32 MB of [[Random access memory|RAM memory]]. Opposed to other variants of [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]], Ubuntulite is focused on [[software]] packages with low resource consumption. Currently ships with the [[LXDE]] desktop environment that use like default window manager [[Openbox]].

== Trademark Dispute ==
+
== Trademark issues ==
On September 10th, Canonical emailed the Ubuntulite developers complaining the project's use of Canonical's names, URLs, and logos violates Canonical's trademarks.<ref>[http://ubuntulite.tuxfamily.org/?q=node/171 A message from Canonical: Change your name . . .]</ref> The owners of the project have not yet announced a new name.
On September 10th, Canonical emailed the Ubuntulite developers complaining the project's use of Canonical's names, URLs, and logos violates Canonical's trademarks.<ref>[http://ubuntulite.tuxfamily.org/?q=node/171 A message from Canonical: Change your name . . .]</ref> The owners of the project have not yet announced a new name.
